titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles N. Fifer collection of Stanford English Department Miscellany
Fifer (Charles N.) collection of Stanford English Department Miscellany
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Charles N. Fifer collection of Stanford English Department miscellany
did.abstract: Collection consists of materials related to the Stanford English Department, including the Cliveden campus (part of the Bing Overseas Studies Program), and correspondence with other English department faculty members. Also included is the two volume work by Fifer, Correspondence of James Boswell with Members of the Literary Club.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Charles N. Fifer collection of Stanford English Department miscellany (SC1154). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles N. Fifer earned his BA and MA at Northwestern University and his Ph.D. (1954) at Yale. He taught at Lawrence College and the University of Illinois before joining the faculty in the Department of English at Stanford University in 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of materials related to the Stanford English Department, including the Cliveden campus (part of the Bing Overseas Studies Program), and correspondence with other English department faculty members. Also included is the two volume work by Fifer, Correspondence of James Boswell with Members of the Literary Club.
